content.title: Scheme For Soft Loan To The Grant-in-aid/ Non-grant In Aid Institutions For Maintenance And Upgradation Of Infrastructure Facilities
content.beneficiary: Non-Government aided institutions and non-grant-in-aid institutions in Goa
content.details: The main objective of the scheme is to support the management of Non-Government aided institutions and non-grant-in-aid institutions in Goa for the upgradation and maintenance of infrastructural facilities, creating a conducive atmosphere for learning.
benefits: Financial support for maintenance and upgradation of infrastructure facilities
Eligibility for both aided and non-aided institutions
eligibility: Institutions must be located in Goa
Institutions should have been in operation for at least 10 years preceding the date of application
Average passing percentage of not below 60% in the last three years out of the five years immediately preceding the date of application
exclusions: Newly established institutions are not eligible
Institutions located outside Goa are not eligible
content.application_process: Eligible institutions should apply in the prescribed format (Appendix 'A') to the Directorate of Higher Education, located at SCERT Building, Porvorim, Penha de Fran√ßa, Goa - 403 521.
documents_required: Cost estimate of the project, certified by a Registered Engineer and Chartered Accountant
Latest audited statements of accounts of the institution
Documents proving ownership of the land where the building will be constructed, such as sale deed/long lease deed, or any other relevant documents

faqs.question: Are Non-Profit Organizations Other Than Societies Registered Under The Societies Registration Act Eligible For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only societies registered under the Societies Registration Act are eligible to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can Institutions Located Outside Goa Apply For The 'Scheme For Soft Loan'?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is specifically meant for institutions situated in Goa.

faqs.question: Is There Any Provision For Extending The Loan Repayment Period If An Institution Faces Financial Difficulties?
faqs.answer: The content does not mention any provision for extending the loan repayment period.

faqs.question: Are Institutions Offering Technical Or Vocational Courses Eligible To Apply For The Soft Loan?
faqs.answer: Yes, institutions providing professional courses, including technical or vocational courses, are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Can Newly Established Institutions Apply For The Soft Loan?
faqs.answer: No, newly established institutions are not eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Are There Any Penalties For Late Repayment Of The Soft Loan?
faqs.answer: The content does not provide details about penalties for late repayment.

faqs.question: Is There Any Interest Charged On The Soft Loan Provided To The Institutions?
faqs.answer: The guidelines do not mention any information about interest charges on the soft loan.

faqs.question: Can The Soft Loan Be Used For Any Purpose Other Than Infrastructural Maintenance And Upgradation?
faqs.answer: No, the soft loan is specifically intended for the maintenance and upgradation of infrastructural facilities.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Loan Amount That Eligible Institutions Can Apply For Under The 'Scheme For Soft Loan'?
faqs.answer: The content does not specify the maximum loan amount.

faqs.question: Can Institutions Providing Non-Professional Courses Apply For The 'Scheme For Soft Loan'?
faqs.answer: Yes, all institutions of higher learning, including those providing non-professional courses, are eligible.

faqs.question: What Are The Eligibility Criteria For The Passing Percentage Of The Institution To Apply For The Soft Loan?
faqs.answer: The institution should have an average passing percentage of not below 60% in the last three years out of the five years immediately preceding the date of application.

faqs.question: Is There Any Restriction On The Utilization Of The Soft Loan Funds?
faqs.answer: The funds must be utilized for the specific purpose of upgrading and maintaining infrastructural facilities.

faqs.question: Can Non-Grant-In-Aid Institutions Apply For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, both aided and non-aided institutions are eligible.

faqs.question: What Are The Essential Documents Required For Applying For The Soft Loan?
faqs.answer: The essential documents include an approved plan of construction, cost estimate, latest audited statements, and ownership documents.

faqs.question: Where Should Eligible Institutions Apply For The Soft Loan?
faqs.answer: Eligible institutions should apply to the Directorate of Higher Education.

faqs.question: How Are Preferences Given To Institutions Applying For The Soft Loan?
faqs.answer: Special preference is given to institutions from less developed Talukas and older institutions.
